 The 3-in-1 stand from Satechi also includes a 5W Apple Watch charger and a 5W wireless charger that's designed for the AirPods, while the 2-in-1 stand has a spot for charging the AirPods. Wireless Charging Stands
Satechi today introduced two new Qi2 charging options, including the 3-in-1 Foldable Qi2 Wireless Charging Stand and 2-in-1 Foldable Qi2 Wireless Charging Stand.
results.raw_content:
CES 2024: Satechi Debuts New Qi2 Wireless Charging Stands
Satechi today introduced two new Qi2 charging options, including the 3-in-1 Foldable Qi2 Wireless Charging Stand and 2-in-1 Foldable Qi2 Wireless Charging Stand. With next-generation Qi2 charging technology, Satechi's chargers are able to charge MagSafe iPhones at up to 15W, the same as official ‌MagSafe‌ chargers from Apple.
The 3-in-1 stand from Satechi also includes a 5W Apple Watch charger and a 5W wireless charger that's designed for the AirPods, while the 2-in-1 stand has a spot for charging the AirPods. Both chargers feature a vegan leather base, an aluminum housing, and a soft silicone charging puck, and they are able to fold down for travel when not in use.
Satechi's 3-in-1 stand is able to provide fast-charging capabilities for the Apple Watch Series 7 and later, plus it comes with a 45W USB-C power adapter. Qi2 uses the same magnetic power profile as ‌MagSafe‌, so these stands work like ‌MagSafe‌ stands without the 7.5W limitation of the prior Qi standard.
The 3-in-1 Foldable Qi2 Wireless Charging Stand will be priced at $130, while the 2-in-1 Foldable Qi2 Wireless Charging Stand will be priced at $80. Both chargers are set to launch in the second quarter of 2024.
Satechi today also announced the launch of the SM1 Slim Mechanical Backlit Bluetooth Keyboard, the company's first mechanical keyboard option. It is compatible with the Mac, and it is priced at $100.

results.title: CES 2024: Satechi Debuts Thunderbolt 4 Hub, 145W USB-C ... - MacRumors
results.content: CES 2024: Satechi Debuts Thunderbolt 4 Hub, 145W USB-C Charger and More Thursday January 11, 2024 4:49 pm PST by Juli Clover Alongside Qi2 wireless charging stands, Apple accessory maker...
results.raw_content:
CES 2024: Satechi Debuts Thunderbolt 4 Hub, 145W USB-C Charger and More
Alongside Qi2 wireless charging stands, Apple accessory maker Satechi this week unveiled new hubs and charger options for Apple's Mac lineup.
The upgraded Stand & Hub for Mac mini and Mac Studio fits under one of Apple's slim desktop machines, and it includes an NVMe SSD enclosure that supports NVMe and M.2 SATA SSDs. There are USB-C 3.1 and USB-A 3.1 ports for file transfers, with support for speeds up to 10Gb/s.
An SSD added into the hub can be used for Time Machine backups, plus there are also two additional USB-A 3.0 ports, micro/SD card readers, and an audio jack for headphones.
Satechi's Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro has three Thunderbolt 4 downstream ports that support data transfers at up to 40GB/s, plus it can deliver up to 15W of power to connected peripherals. It supports up to two 4K displays or one 8K display, and it offers 32Gb/s native PCIe support for external GPUs and Thunderbolt-based SSDs.
The 145W USB-C 4-Port GaN Travel Charger has two USB-C 3.1 ports that can provide up to 140W and two USB-C 3.0 ports that can provide up to 45W. The 145W max power is split between devices when more than one device is plugged in, with the charger providing smart power distribution that automatically adjusts wattage for optimal charging.
All three devices are available today from the Satechi website. The Stand & Hub for Mac mini/Mac Studio is priced at $100, the Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro is $200, and the 145W Travel Charger is $120. A 20 percent discount is available with the promo code CES20.

results.title: Satechi unveil a host of new and upgraded products at CES 2024 ...
results.content: Satechi has come to CES 2024 with a wide range of products including something entirely new for them, a mechanical keyboard. Among their other new products are a 145W USB-C 4-Port GaN Travel Charger, new Qi2 chargers, a Thunderbolt 4 hub and a Mac Mini/studio stand/hub.
results.raw_content:
Select Page
Satechi unveil a host of new and upgraded products at CES 2024 including a mechanical keyboard
Posted by Scott Plowman | Jan 13, 2024 | CES, News, Tech
Satechi has come to CES 2024 with a wide range of products including something entirely new for them, a mechanical keyboard. Among their other new products are a 145W USB-C 4-Port GaN Travel Charger, new Qi2 chargers, a Thunderbolt 4 hub and a Mac Mini/studio stand/hub.
The newest product to the Satechi lineup is the SM1 Slim Mechanical Backlit Bluetooth Keyboard. It is designed with a low profile for efficiency and comfort, and functions seamlessly with both Mac and Windows devices. It includes 14 different backlight patterns and high quality clicky switches.
The 145W USB-C 4-Port GaN Travel Charger includes four interchangeable international adapters (EU/AU/UK/US) and a mesh carry bag. Using smart power distribution, it will deliver the correct amount of charging power to each device as required and what it can handle.
The new Qi2 wireless charging stands include a 3-in-1 foldable Qi2 wireless charging stand and a 2-in-1 version. Unfortunately, the new Qi2 wireless chargers will not be available for purchase for “a few more months.”
Satechi has also revamped their Stand and Hub for Mac Mini and Studio. It now features an NVME SSD enclosure to expand users’ connectivity options through a single cable and added storage.
The new Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro is the pro version of their previous Thunderbolt dock, now supporting data transfer speeds of up to 40Gbps and up to 8K/60Hz video output and can also deliver up to 96W of charging. Up to six devices can now be daisy chained and provides 32Gpbs native PCIe support for external GPUs and Thunderbolt-based SSDs.
To check out these new products head over to the Satechi CES page and keep an eye out for them arriving in Australia soon.
EFTM’s Coverage of CES 2024 is made possible by the ongoing support of our regular advertisers and supporters such as Arlo, Belkin, Oppo, Motorola, Ecovacs, LG, Netgear, JBL and Trend Micro, and by additional support from Samsung, LG, Hisense, TCL, and ASUS

results.title: Satechi SM1 Slim mechanical keyboard debuts at CES 2024 with $20 ...
results.content: By Hilda Scott. published 11 January 2024. Take $20 off the new Satechi SM1 Slim mechanical keyboard. (Image credit: Satechi ) Lauched at CES 2024 Tuesday, the Satechi SM1 Slim Mechanical Backlit ...
results.raw_content:
When you purchase through links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission. Here’s how it works.
Satechi SM1 Slim mechanical keyboard debuts at CES 2024 with $20 discount in tow
Take $20 off the new Satechi SM1 Slim mechanical keyboard
Lauched at CES 2024 Tuesday, the Satechi SM1 Slim Mechanical Backlit Bluetooth Keyboard is available for purchase at Satechi.net. It costs $99.99, however, you'll save $20 when you apply coupon "CES20" at checkout.
Satechi manufactures some of the best accessories for laptops, tablets, and phones. The M1 Slim is Satechi's first wireless mechanical keyboard for Mac and Windows devices. Sleek and ergonomic, it lives up to its name with its slender aluminum exterior. With 14 different backlight patterns and customizable settings, the M1 Slim makes it easy to jazz up your workspace.
Satechi's M1 Slim keyboard's low-profile tactile brown switches offer the smoothness of red switches and physical feedback of blue switches. Brown switches are also quiet so this keyboard is suitable for the office or shared dorm room.
The M1 Slim keyboard also features removable keycaps, a short key travel distance, and adjustable feet to keep it stable when typing on uneven surfaces. What's more, the M1 Slim keyboard can connect to up to four devices at a time. Easily between devices with the press of the FN key and designated number key. Keys 1 and 2 support Bluetooth 5.0, key 3 employs a 2.4 GHz USB receiver, and key 4 is for wired mode.
Lightweight and compact, the SM1 Slim Mechanical Backlit Bluetooth Keyboard is portable for on-the-go lifestyle. Powered by a built-in 2500mAh rechargeable battery, its USB-C port supports both charging and wired mode. It works with iOS, iPadOS, macOS, Windows OS, and Chrome OS devices.
If you want to add a mechanical keyboard to your gadget collection for the new year, the Satechi SM1 Slim is worth checking out.

results.title: Satechi Unveils Its First Mechanical Keyboard At CES 2024 - Forbes
results.content: However, the wait is over with the announcement at CES 2024 that Satechi is joining the stampede for mechanical keyboards. The new SM1 wireless mechanical keyboard features a low profile and ...
results.raw_content:
More From Forbes
Satechi Unveils Its First Mechanical Keyboard At CES 2024
The SM1 keyboard from Satechi has a mechanical mechanism instead of the more usual membrane design. ... [+] The keyboard ships with Windows and Mac keys.
It’s been a while since computer accessory brand Satechi launched a new keyboard. However, the wait is over with the announcement at CES 2024 that Satechi is joining the stampede for mechanical keyboards.
The new SM1 wireless mechanical keyboard features a low profile and backlit keycaps. This is Satechi’s first mechanical keyboard that functions seamlessly with Mac and Windows devices. Other brands like Logitech and Keychron have already launched these kinds of keyboards, but this is a first for Satechi.
The rechargeable keyboard has a compact 75% layout with low-profile brown switches. The SM1 can connect with up to four separate devices, enabling a seamless transition from computers to tablets or smartphones with just the press of a few keys.
The SM1 keyboard from Satechi is wireless and can connect over Bluetooth or 2.4GHz RF using the ... [+] supplied USB dongle.
The SM1 supports multiple operating systems, including iOS, iPadOS, macOS, Windows OS and Google Chrome OS. The keyboard ships with Windows keycaps such as “Win, alt, alt” that can replace the factory-fitted macOS CMD and Opt keys.
Samsung Makes Surprise New Offer To Galaxy S24 Buyers
Google Launches Surprise New Pixel 8 With Free Offer And Big Price Drop
Google Suddenly Reveals Huge Free AI Upgrade For All Android Users
The SM1 has 14 different backlight patterns and a dedicated lock screen shortcut for extra security when used on macOS computers. The sleek and ergonomic design is housed in a slim aluminum enclosure and the keycaps can be removed and replaced. To ensure the SM1 can be used at an optimal angle, adjustable feet can be set for the most comfortable typing position to reduce strain on the wrists and hands.
Unlike some mechanical keyboards, the low-profile SM1 doesn’t offer hot-swappable switches, but its Brown switches fitted to the SM1 provide the smoothness of Red switches and the physical feedback of Blue switches. Brown switches offer an ideal balance and have a short travel distance that can reduce finger fatigue. Brown switches are also quiet, making them suitable for office environments or shared working spaces.
This slim and low profile mechanical keyboard from Satechi has white backlights behind each key.
As well as providing connectivity with three different devices over Bluetooth, the Satechi SM1 keyboard can connect with a fourth device by using the supplied 2.4 GHz USB dongle. Using RF wireless connectivity, the dongle offers excellent response times compared to Bluetooth. And for those who want a traditional wired connection, the SM1 can do that, too.
A handy feature included with the SM1 is the use of stabilizers located beneath the delete key, the return key, the space bar and the left shift key. Stabilizers bring more solidity to larger keys that might otherwise rattle when pressed.
The SM1 has a 2500mAh rechargeable battery, which is charged via a USB-C port. Using a rechargeable battery means there’s no need for alkaline power cells, which Satechi says is better for the environment. If the battery runs down, the keyboard can be plugged into a computer and you can continue typing while the battery recharges.
Pricing & Availability: Satechi’s SM1 Slim Mechanical Backlit Bluetooth Keyboard is available now on Satechi.net for $99.99. Early shoppers can receive 20% off using the code CES20.
More info:

results.title: Satechi's new Qi2 charging stands are stylish and storable
results.content: Satechi has announced its first Qi2 wireless charging stands, a 2-in-1 option for iPhones and AirPods, and a 3-in-1 that also charges the Apple Watch, coming in the second quarter.
results.raw_content:
Satechi’s new Qi2 charging stands are stylish and storable
Satechi’s new Qi2 charging stands are stylish and storable
Now that Qi2 is here, options are opening up for full 15 watts of wireless charging on Apple’s Qi2-compatible MagSafe phones.
By
Wes Davis, a weekend editor who covers the latest in tech and entertainment. He has written news, reviews, and more as a tech journalist since 2020.
Share this story
Our universal, wireless, magnetic, and fast-charging future is here as the first Qi2 chargers start to arrive, and Satechi is showing off its first two compatible products today at CES.
Both devices are folding stands designed to charge a pair of earbuds and a phone — using MagSafe or Qi2 — at the same time, while the higher-end of the devices adds an Apple Watch charger to the back. The company said in its announcement that they’ll be available in the second quarter of the year, costing $79.99 for the 2-in-1 stand and $129.99 for the 3-in-1 version.
Satechi’s new stands fold flat and come with a 45W power supply and two travel adapters for foreign plugs. Satechi even says the 3-in-1 model supports fast charging for the Apple Watches that feature it.
Satechi exacts a heavy toll with its prices, but that’s been the running theme for early Qi2 charging stands like these. Nomad announced a $100 Qi2 charger, but it doesn’t include the required 20W adapter and only charges a single device. Mophie announced its first Qi2 stands back in September, pricing its 3-in-1 option around $130 as well. And Belkin’s Qi2 3-in-1 charging pad comes in at the same price. But none of those stands fold, so... that’s one way for Satechi to stand out.
Still, it’s nice knowing that we’re heading into a new world where charging an iPhone doesn’t require careful calculus and research, wires or no. Well, I take that back. USB-C is still a horrible rat king of a standard.

Satechi Debuts Mechanical Keyboard Featuring Four-Device Connectivity, Backlit Keys, and Cross-Platform Compatibility at CES 2024
Satechi, known for producing accessories that make everyday life more convenient, introduces the SM1 Slim Mechanical Backlit Bluetooth Keyboard, its first mechanical keyboard that is designed to seamlessly function with both Mac® and Windows® systems.
The rechargeable keyboard features a 75% layout with low-profile brown switches, four-device connectivity, 14 different backlight patterns, and a lock screen shortcut for added security with macOS®. The new mechanical keyboard has a sleek, ergonomic design with a slim aluminum enclosure, removable keycaps, and adjustable feet for optimum stability and comfort.
UPGRADE AND MODERNIZE ANY WORKSPACE
The SM1 Slim Mechanical Backlit Bluetooth Keyboard’s connectivity, backlight settings, and brown switches provide users with options to customize their keyboard and seamlessly upgrade their workspace. It can accommodate up to four devices at a time which users can easily switch between by pressing the FN key followed by keys 1, 2, 3, or 4. With one press of a button, users can seamlessly go from sending an email on a computer to finishing a grocery list on a phone. Keys 1 and 2 support Bluetooth 5.0 channels, while key 3 utilizes a 2.4 GHz USB receiver to wirelessly connect to an additional peripheral, and key 4 supports wired mode.
The new keyboard comes with an adjustable white backlight that supports 14 different patterns and can be easily enabled with a press of the lightbulb key located above the delete key. For unmatched tactile feedback and faster actuation, Satechi employs low-profile brown switches, which combine the smoothness of red switches with the physical feedback of blue switches. Designed to strike the perfect balance between typing and gaming, the keyboard’s brown switches boast a shorter travel distance that reduces finger fatigue and promotes a more comfortable typing experience. They also offer a quieter operation, making them ideal for office environments or shared spaces.
ADJUSTABLE, RECHARGEABLE, ERGONOMIC DESIGN FOR EVERYDAY CONVENIENCE
Prioritizing user comfort, Satechi made the SM1 Slim Mechanical Backlit Bluetooth Keyboard height adjustable, allowing users to tailor the angle of the keyboard to help reduce strain on the wrists and hands. The adjustable feet also provide added stability, allowing the keyboard to adapt to uneven surfaces and preventing movement while typing. To ensure fast typing and quick response from the keys, the new keyboard has a shorter body and key travel distance. It also includes stabilizers located beneath the delete key, the return key, the space bar, and the left shift key to allow for a uniform key press. Light and compact with a minimalist, low-profile design, the SM1 keyboard is equally effective for on-the-go use as it is stationed in an office or workspace. It comes in a light color variant and is easy to clean, providing an aesthetically pleasing addition to any setup.
The keyboard employs a rechargeable 2500mAh battery with a future-proof USB-C port that can be used for both charging and wired mode. Its reversible plug design facilitates easy connection and boasts a durable connector for a longer lifespan. Opting for a rechargeable keyboard over one that requires disposable batteries minimizes environmental waste, making the SM1 keyboard an efficient, eco-friendly solution for all your typing needs.
CROSS-PLATFORM COMPATIBLE WITH A VARIETY OF DEVICES
The SM1 Slim Mechanical Backlit Bluetooth Keyboard supports multiple operating systems including iOS®, iPadOS®, macOS®, Windows OS®, and Google Chrome OS® that can be used with a variety of USB-C devices. Users with a varied setup, can quickly and conveniently transition between platforms with the specific OS keys. The keyboard also comes with Windows® keys such as “Win, alt, alt” that can replace the Mac® “CMD” and “Opt” keys.
PRICING AND AVAILABILITY
Satechi’s SM1 Slim Mechanical Backlit Bluetooth Keyboard is available now on Satechi.net for $99.99 and early shoppers can receive 20% off with code CES20.
For more information, visit satechi.net, Facebook, and X (Twitter).
ABOUT SATECHI:
Satechi believes that technology should be limitless, timeless, and forever evolving to fit any modern lifestyle. The brand produces tech products and accessories that make everyday life more convenient for the fast-paced world we live in. Satechi strives for efficiency without compromising style. Each Satechi product is made with tough and durable materials, while still maintaining a sleek design perfect for the contemporary individual. For more information, please visit www.Satechi.net.

Satechi Announces New Upgraded Version of Best-Selling Stand & Hub for Mac mini® and Mac Studio® and Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub at CES 2024
With customer feedback and satisfaction at the forefront of Satechi’s mission to deliver the most convenient and efficient products, Satechi unveils updated versions of two of the brand’s best selling devices – the Stand & Hub for Mac mini® and Mac Studio® and Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro at CES 2024 – both of which are available now.
The new Stand & Hub for Mac mini® and Mac Studio® now features a NVMe SSD enclosure to expand users’ connectivity options through a single cable for faster speeds and added storage, while the new Pro version of the Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub is ideal for creative professionals and supports up to 40Gbps data transfer speeds and up to 8K/60Hz video output while delivering 96W of charging to the host device. The updated version also allows users to daisy-chain up to six devices at once and provides 32Gpbs native PCIe support for external GPUs and Thunderbolt-based SSDs.
UPGRADED STAND & HUB NOW SUPPORTING BOTH NVMe AND M.2 SATA SSD
Optimized to read both NVMe and M.2 SATA SSDs, the Stand & Hub for Mac mini and Mac Studio has an upgraded SSD enclosure that provides faster data transfer and increased storage capacity to help users maximize efficiency and minimize clutter. Driven by Gen 2 USB-C technology, the USB-C 3.1 and USB-A 3.1 ports allow users to transfer files, photos and videos twice as fast with speeds up to 10Gbps. The SSD feature can also quickly and easily complete Time Machine backups on Macs, ensuring all valuable information is securely saved.
Crafted to feel like a natural extension of the Mac mini and Mac Studio, the Stand & Hub’s exclusive, patented design connects through a single cable on the back of the hub to optimize space and streamline users’ setups. Its innovative construction also features elevated mounting brackets to ensure a secure hold and carefully positioned vents to promote airflow and keep devices cool. The compact hub also includes a USB-C 3.1 data port, USB-A 3.1 data port, two USB-A 3.0 data ports, micro/SD card readers, and an audio jack for maximum convenience and connectivity.
THUNDERBOLT 4 TECHNOLOGY WITH INCREASED POWER
An upgraded version of the Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub launched at CES 2023, the new Pro version is equipped with a larger 150W GaN power supply and capable of outputting up to 96W of power to the host device – a 60% increase from the 60W of its predecessor. The power supply
utilizes the latest GaN technology, enabling the Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro to charge even the most power-hungry devices while maintaining a small, lightweight profile.
The Satechi Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro utilizes advanced Thunderbolt 4 technology with three Thunderbolt 4 downstream ports that support up to 40Gbps of blazing-fast data transfers and robust video output for up to two 4K displays or one 8K display. In addition to delivering 15W of power to connected peripherals, the upgraded hub allows users to daisy-chain up to six devices at once and provides 32Gpbs native PCIe support for external GPUs and Thunderbolt-based SSDs. The Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro is backward compatible with Thunderbolt 3 and USB standards and certified through Thunderbolt, ensuring optimal performance and durability.
The hub is meticulously crafted with aircraft-grade aluminum and unique chamfered edges with a slim Space Gray design that takes up minimal desk space. Users can connect their MacBook®, Microsoft Surface®, or other USB-C devices to the Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro for seamless use.
PRICING AND AVAILABILITY
Satechi’s Stand & Hub for Mac mini® and Mac Studio® with NVMe SSD Enclosure and Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro are available now on Satechi.net for $99.99 and $199.99, respectively, and early shoppers can receive 20% off with code CES20.
For more information, visit satechi.net, Facebook, and X (Twitter).
ABOUT SATECHI:
Satechi believes that technology should be limitless, timeless, and forever evolving to fit any modern lifestyle. The brand produces tech products and accessories that make everyday life more convenient for the fast-paced world we live in. Satechi strives for efficiency without compromising style. Each Satechi product is made with tough and durable materials, while still maintaining a sleek design perfect for the contemporary individual. For more information, please visit www.Satechi.net.

results.title: Satechi's New Thunderbolt 4 Hub Can Also Charge Your Laptop - How-To Geek
results.content: Satechi has now revealed two new Thunderbolt hubs at CES 2024, and they look great. Satechi has revealed the Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro (pictured above), an upgraded version of the model released last year at CES 2023. It has the same three Thunderbolt 4 downstream ports with 40Gbps speeds—perfect for fast external storage, high-resolution ...
results.raw_content:
How-To Geek
Satechi’s New Thunderbolt 4 Hub Can Also Charge Your Laptop
There's also a hub built specifically for the Mac Mini and Mac Studio.
The best USB-C hubs can help you connect more devices to your laptop, desktop, tablet, or even phone. More bandwidth is sometimes required, though, which is where Thunderbolt hubs can help. Satechi has now revealed two new Thunderbolt hubs at CES 2024, and they look great.
Satechi has revealed the Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro (pictured above), an upgraded version of the model released last year at CES 2023. It has the same three Thunderbolt 4 downstream ports with 40Gbps speeds—perfect for fast external storage, high-resolution monitors, and other devices that require a faster connections than USB 3 (and most USB 4 devices) can provide. It's also backwards compatible with Thunderbolt 3 and USB-C devices, and there's native 32Gbps PCIe support for external GPUs and Thunderbolt-based SSDs.
The main difference with the Pro model is that it uses a larger 150W power supply, and can charge the connected computer at up to 96W instead of 60W. That's still not enough for some powerful laptops—Apple recommends 140W for the 14 and 16-inch MacBook Pro, for example—but many ultrabooks and tablets won't need a separate power connection when connected to the dock. The hub also provides 15W of power to other connected devices. It has the same "aircraft-grade aluminum" portable design as the earlier model, with a Space Gray color designed to match Apple products.
Satechi also announced an updated "Stand & Hub for Mac Mini and Mac Studio" (pictured above), which as the same suggests, is a Thunderbolt hub built specifically for the Apple Mac Mini and Mac Studio. It fits perfectly underneath the Mac, adding font-facing ports and a hidden NVMe storage for more storage. The hub has a USB Type-C 3.1 port, a USB Type-A 3.1 connector, two USB Type-A 3.0 ports, SD and microSD card slots, and an audio jack—all powered by a single Thunderbolt connection to the Mac. It's a great way to add more connectivity to a Mac Mini or Mac Studio without the clutter of a hub or more cables sitting beside the computer.
You can buy the Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro from Satechi's online store now for $100, and the Stand & Hub for Mac mini and Mac Studio is available for $200. For a limited time, you can use code CES20 at checkout on Satechi's online store to get 20% off.
Source: Satechi
The Best Tech Newsletter Around

Corbin Davenport is the News Editor at How-To Geek and an independent software developer. He also runs Tech Tales, a technology history podcast, and writes for The Spacebar.

results.title: Satechi's New GaN 145W Travel Charger Is Ready For Take-Off - Forbes
results.content: The final Satechi product to be announced at CES 2024 is the brand's 145W USB-C 4-port GaN travel charger. This device could be the only power adapter necessary for a business trip and I've...
results.raw_content:
More From Forbes
Satechi’s New GaN 145W Travel Charger Is Ready For Take-Off
The new Satechi 145W USB-C 4-port GaN travel charger could be the only power adapter you need for a ... [+] business trip.
I offer no apologies today for highlighting yet another useful computer accessory from Satechi. The company seems to be on a roll right now with some excellent products announced at CES 2024, making working life a little bit easier.
The final Satechi product to be announced at CES 2024 is the brand’s 145W USB-C 4-port GaN travel charger. This device could be the only power adapter necessary for a business trip and I’ve had a chance to get my hands on it.
With a maximum power output of 145W, the charger has enough muscle to power and recharge almost any laptop while also topping up your smartphone or some other small-scale tech like a pair of true wireless headphones.
The new 145W USB-C 4-port GaN travel charger from Satechi has power adapters for EU, UK, Australia ... [+] and USA.
Satechi’s new charger uses the latest generation Gallium Nitride (GaN) technology, which enables chargers to be smaller and more efficient without compromising on power output. The next-generation GaN technology runs cooler and is more power-efficient than the old silicon-based chargers most of us are used to. Having four power outputs for all your gadgets means the Satechi travel charger can save a lot of space in you carry-on luggage when flying on business trips.
Best High-Yield Savings Accounts Of September 2023
Best 5% Interest Savings Accounts of September 2023
The 145W travel charger has a total of four USB-C PD ports. Two ports are USB-C PD 3.1, while the other two are USB-C PD 3.0. Satechi says the charger can safely power up to four devices simultaneously. The PD1 and PD2 ports can deliver up to 140W of power from a single port, which is plenty for recharging and powering even the most advanced USB-C laptop. The PD3 and PD4 ports can deliver up to 45W from one port, making it ideal for charging a tablet or smartphone.
This compact charger’s GaN circuitry actively prevents heat from reaching the charger’s exterior case while still delivering a mighty charge. Satechi says the charger can power even the most current-hungry devices, including the 16-inch MacBook Pro, the Lenovo Legion Slim 7i and the Legion 7i. The charger can also charge additional Apple and Windows devices, power banks and peripherals and it’s universally compatible with USB-C PD devices.
The small size and low weight of the new Satechi charger means it can plug directly into a power wall outlet without straining the socket. The package also includes four interchangeable power adapters for EU, Australia, UK and US, plus there’s a mesh carrying bag to keep everything together when traveling.
One thing worth pointing out with this new charger is that it’s quite heavy and there’s no option to use a cable instead of one of the international adapters. The charger has to be plugged directly into a wall socket so watch out when plugging it into sockets with a loose or insecure grip.
Verdict: The new Satechi 145W USB-C 4-port GaN travel charger is a beast. It has four USB-C ports and up to 140W available to a single device. It has four international adapters for traveling which makes it perfect for travellers. The GaN circuitry reduces temperature and power consumption, making for a safer charger that won’t fry your gadgets.
Pricing & Availability: Satechi’s new 145W USB-C 4-Port GaN Travel Charger is available now on Satechi.net for $119.99 and early shoppers can receive 20% off using code CES20.
More info: Satechi.net

Satechi Unveils New Qi2 Wireless Charging Stands Providing Convenient and Travel-Friendly Solutions at CES 2024
Satechi, known for producing accessories that make everyday life more convenient, announces its newest wireless charging solutions employing the latest Qi2 technology at CES 2024.
The 3-in-1 Foldable Qi2 Wireless Charging Stand and 2-in-1 Foldable Qi2 Wireless Charging Stand offer powerful charging to simultaneously deliver 15W of power to an iPhone®, 5W of power to AirPods®, and 5W of power to an Apple Watch®. Both designed to be foldable and travel-friendly, the 3-in-1 and 2-in-1 Charging Stands each feature a premium-grade aluminum enclosure, vegan leather base, soft silicone charging puck, and sturdy, durable hinges that won’t weaken over time, enabling optimal viewing in both portrait and landscape mode.
LATEST Qi2 TECHNOLOGY TO POWERFULLY AND SIMULTANEOUSLY CHARGE UP TO THREE DEVICES
Utilizing innovative Qi2 technology, the Satechi 3-in-1 Foldable Qi2 Wireless Charging Stand and 2-in-1 Foldable Qi2 Wireless Charging Stand make powering up all the daily essentials easy with its single-cable solution. The charging stands provide a Qi2 magnetic charging puck for an iPhone and a wireless charging pad located at the base for AirPods, with the 3-in-1 having an additional charging base on the back of the stand for the entire Apple Watch lineup including fast-charging capabilities with the Series 7, 8, 9, Ultra, and Ultra 2. The 3-in-1 Charging Stand also includes a 45W power adapter that can be used separately to charge other USB-C devices.
The new charging stands deliver twice as much power to the iPhone, providing 15W of power as opposed to the 7.5W limitation of standard Qi devices. Users can power AirPods and the Apple Watch at 5W. Both charging stands boast powerful integrated magnets that are optimized to support MagSafe-compatible iPhones which ensures proper coil alignment for an optimally efficient charge. They also support StandBy mode in iOS 17, allowing users to view important information while their device is charging in landscape orientation.
TRAVEL-FRIENDLY AND PREMIUM DESIGN COMPATIBLE WITH APPLE® LINEUP
For convenient charging both at home and on-the-go, the 3-in-1 and 2-in-1 Qi2 Wireless Charging Stands have a foldable design, making them small enough to tuck into a tote bag, backpack, or carry-on. The compact, lightweight profile also helps reduce packaging size and weight which minimizes waste. To make international travel even easier, the 3-in-1 Charging Stand comes with two travel adapters for the included 45W power adapter.
Crafted using only the finest quality materials, the new Qi2 charging stands each have a sleek, premium-grade aluminum enclosure that helps extend the lifespan of the devices and ensures maximum durability. They also each feature a scratch-resistant vegan-leather base and a soft silicone charging puck that protects the phone from damage and prevents the puck from cracking over time. The sturdy, durable hinges are optimized to support the complete iPhone lineup including the iPhone 15 through iPhone 12.
PRICING AND AVAILABILITY
Satechi’s 3-in-1 Foldable Qi2 Wireless Charging Stand and 2-in-1 Foldable Qi2 Wireless Charging Stand will be available Q2 2024 on Satechi.net for $129.99 and $79.99, respectively. Interested customers can sign up for an email alert to be notified once available for purchase.
For more information, visit satechi.net, Facebook, and X (Twitter).
ABOUT SATECHI:
Satechi believes that technology should be limitless, timeless, and forever evolving to fit any modern lifestyle. The brand produces tech products and accessories that make everyday life more convenient for the fast-paced world we live in. Satechi strives for efficiency without compromising style. Each Satechi product is made with tough and durable materials, while still maintaining a sleek design perfect for the contemporary individual. For more information, please visit www.Satechi.net.

results.title: Satechi Reveals Updated Stand & Hub for Mac Mini at CES 2024
results.content: There are updated versions of the Satechi Stand & Hub for Mac mini and Mac Studio and Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro launching at CES 2024, both of which feature an NVMe SSD enclosure to expand connectivity options through a single cable for faster speeds and added storage.
results.raw_content:
Archives
Categories
Meta
￼Satechi Reveals Updated Stand & Hub for Mac Mini at CES 2024
There are updated versions of the Satechi Stand & Hub for Mac mini and Mac Studio and Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro launching at CES 2024, both of which feature an NVMe SSD enclosure to expand connectivity options through a single cable for faster speeds and added storage.
The new Pro version of the Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub is ideal for creative professionals, says Satechi, offering support for up to 40Gbps data transfer speeds and up to 8K/60Hz video output while delivering 96W of charging to the host device. The updated version also allows you to daisy-chain up to six devices at once and provides 32Gpbs native PCIe support for external GPUs and Thunderbolt-based SSDs.
Optimized to read both NVMe and M.2 SATA SSDs, the Stand & Hub for Mac mini and Mac Studio has an upgraded SSD enclosure that provides faster data transfer and increased storage capacity to help you maximize efficiency and minimize clutter. Driven by Gen 2 USB-C technology, the USB-C 3.1 and USB-A 3.1 ports allow you to transfer files, photos, and videos twice as fast with speeds up to 10Gbps. The SSD feature can also quickly and easily complete Time Machine backups on Macs, ensuring all valuable information is securely saved.
Crafted to feel like a natural extension of the Mac mini and Mac Studio, the Stand & Hub’s exclusive, patented design connects through a single cable on the back of the hub to optimize space and streamline your setup. It also features elevated mounting brackets to ensure a secure hold and carefully positioned vents to promote airflow and keep devices cool. The compact hub also includes a USB-C 3.1 data port, USB-A 3.1 data port, two USB-A 3.0 data ports, micro/SD card readers, and an audio jack.
An upgraded version of the Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub that launched at CES 2023, the new Pro version is equipped with a larger 150W GaN power supply and capable of outputting up to 96W of power to the host device – a 60% increase from the 60W of its predecessor. The power supply uses the latest GaN technology, enabling the Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro to charge power-hungry devices while maintaining a small, lightweight profile.
The Satechi Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro uses advanced Thunderbolt 4 technology with three Thunderbolt 4 downstream ports that support up to 40Gbps of blazing-fast data transfers and robust video output for up to two 4K displays or one 8K display. In addition to delivering 15W of power to connected peripherals, the upgraded hub allows you to daisy-chain up to six devices at once and provides 32Gpbs native PCIe support for external GPUs and Thunderbolt-based SSDs. The Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro is backward compatible with Thunderbolt 3 and USB standards and certified through Thunderbolt.
The hub is crafted with aircraft-grade aluminum and unique chamfered edges with a slim Space Gray design that takes up minimal desk space. Connect a MacBook, Microsoft Surface, or other USB-C devices to the Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro for seamless use.
Satechi’s Stand & Hub for Mac mini and Mac Studio with NVMe SSD Enclosure and Thunderbolt 4 Slim Hub Pro are available now for US$100 and US$200, respectively.
